articles.title: Congratulations to Iranian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Iranian President
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Hassan Rouhani upon his reelection as president of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
					 The message said that his reelection as president of Iran was an expression of the deep trust and support of the Iranian people for him.
					
					 It wished the Iranian president success in his responsible work for building independent and prosperous Iran, expressing the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger in the joint struggle for defending the peace and stability of the world and realizing the genuine international justice.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Sunday had a talk with Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: More "Juche Weapons" Capable of Striking U.S. Will Be Launched: Minju Joson
articles.content:
More "Juche Weapons" Capable of Striking U.S. Will Be Launched: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK successfully test-fired the ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 on May 14. The rocket reflected the spirit, courage and will of the DPRK. The DPRK did not give any explanation about it but left it up to the world to judge.
					 The world told the U.S. what the DPRK wanted to say.
					
					 As recognized by the world, the DPRK has become a nuclear power in the East and a leading rocket power in Asia in the true sense of the words, and it has been proven in reality that the U.S. has no force to check the vigorous advance of Juche Korea, Minju Joson Sunday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 It is tragedy that the U.S. has completely lost its sense of judging the situation.
					
					 The U.S. is going about irresponsibly, while crying out for putting pressure on the DPRK although it is just about to face nuclear strike.
					
					 A lot of Americans, being caught in uneasiness and horror, dissuade the Trump administration from its dangerous hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The Trump administration would be well advised to lend an ear to the voices of concern that are heard from the U.S. and international community.
					
					 If the U.S. persists in confrontation with the DPRK, the latter will show how the crime-woven history of the U.S. is put to an end.
					
					 Many more "Juche weapons" capable of striking the U.S. will be launched from this land. This is the DPRK's answer to the Trump administration.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Forces' Spy Moves against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Forces' Spy Moves against DPRK under Fire
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. set up a Korea mission centre, whose main duty is to gather and analyze information on the DPRK, at the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) allegedly to "counter nuclear threat from the north". Meanwhile, the south Korean puppet forces are busy test-flying a new type reconnaissance plane for eavesdropping communication information in the region of the DPRK and collecting signal information about each weapon system with the purpose of deploying it to go into action within this year.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such moves are another unpardonable provocation aimed to "overthrow the social system" of the DPRK and ignite a war for aggression on it.
					
					 Recently the U.S. and south Korean forces have run amuck to stifle the DPRK from every direction, vociferating about the "north's nuclear and missile threats". But their desperate moves cannot prove effective in the face of the invincible might of the DPRK.
					
					 Eventually, they came to resort to the sinister scheme with hope pinned on the espionage against the DPRK.
					
					 The espionage serves as an open hostile act against the opposite side and a prelude to war provocation.
					
					 The reality indicates that the U.S. and puppet forces' sinister scenario to undermine the dignified socialist system of the DPRK and realize a wild ambition to invade it has entered the practical phase of full-scale implementation.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon in the least the provokers who dare go reckless to do harm to the inviolable sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK while getting engrossed in the despicable acts of espionage.
					
					 The Korean-style war on terrorism will be conducted in a consecutive and intensive way to root out the plot-breeding machines of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet group of traitors who are the most wicked and brutal in the world.

articles.title: Japan Finance Minister Slashed for Faulting DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence
articles.content:
Japan Finance Minister Slashed for Faulting DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Japan Finance Minister Aso recently had talks with the U.S. Treasury secretary to discuss on the issue of tightening sanctions against the DPRK over its nuclear deterrence. At the talks he said that the "country without common sense" has in its possession a dangerous weapon.
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Sunday terms Aso's description of the DPRK's nuclear deterrence as a dangerous weapon a revelation of his low judging ability and ignorance of matters and phenomena.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 What is most dangerous on the earth is the U.S. nuclear weapons which are used to put threat and blackmail on other countries.
					
					 The nuclear weapon of the DPRK is a powerful deterrence for self-defence to prevent a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, and it is a treasured sword for safeguarding the security and peace in the region.
					
					 It is an established fact that a thermonuclear war on the Korean peninsula which may break out due to the U.S. ruckus for nuclear war would bring catastrophic disaster to the Japanese archipelago that has been reduced to the U.S. nuclear outpost and logistic base.
					
					 In such aspect, the DPRK's nuclear weapons are defending the security of Japan, too. The Japanese reactionaries are obliged to thank the DPRK, not slandering it.
					
					 It is a height of folly which would make even a cat to laugh for Aso, a man ignorant of the elementary relationships between cause and effect, to talk about "common sense" and the like.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better keep silent, mindful that their tongue-lashing would invite greater shame and disgrace.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Praised by DR Congo Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Praised by DR Congo Party Leader
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Jimmy Kikoni, general secretary of the Workers' Party of DR Congo, visited the DPRK embassy in Kinshasa on May 6 to celebrate the first anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Extending the sincerest congratulations to Kim Jong Un, the general secretary said:
					
					 His election as chairman of the WPK is an epochal landmark in the development of the Party and a great encouragement to the progressive parties struggling for socialism and global independence.
					
					 At the 7th WPK Congress, he stressed the need to advance under the uplifted banner of modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 Through the Congress, the DPRK demonstrated the rock-firm will to hasten the final victory in the revolutionary cause of Juche, pioneered by Comrade Kim Il Sung and advanced by Comrade Kim Jong Il, under the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the struggle of the WPK for implementing the important tasks set forth at the Congress.
					
					 Meanwhile, Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou on May 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report to Party Congress Introduced in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report to Party Congress Introduced in Russia
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's report to the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the work of its Central Committee was introduced in Russia to mark the first anniversary of his election as chairman of the WPK.
					 Russia's online magazine Lemchich posted the full text of "4. For Global Independence" from the report on May 8 and the Russian internet homepage Patrioti Moskva the full text of "3. For the Independent Reunification of the Country" on May 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Congratulations to Iranian President
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Hassan Rouhani upon his reelection as president of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
					 The message said that his reelection as president of Iran was an expression of the deep trust and support of the Iranian people for him.
					
					 It wished the Iranian president success in his responsible work for building independent and prosperous Iran, expressing the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger in the joint struggle for defending the peace and stability of the world and realizing the genuine international justice.
